item.title: Boundary symmetries of (2+1)D topological orders
item.description: arXiv:2408.10832v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We elaborate an algebraic framework for describing internal topological symmetries of gapped boundaries of (2+1)D topological orders. We present a categorical obstruction to the coherence of bulk group symmetry and boundary symmetries in terms of liftings of categorical actions on the bulk theory to a certain 2-group of boundary symmetries.
item.dc:creator: Kylan Schatz

item.title: A contramodule generalization of Neeman's flat and projective module theorem
item.description: arXiv:2408.10928v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This paper builds on top of arXiv:2306.02734. We consider a complete, separated topological ring $\mathfrak R$ with a countable base of neighborhoods of zero consisting of open two-sided ideals. The main result is that the homotopy category of projective left $\mathfrak R$-contramodules is equivalent to the derived category of the exact category of flat left $\mathfrak R$-contramodules. In other words, a complex of flat $\mathfrak R$-contramodules is contraacyclic in the sense of Becker if and only if it is an acyclic complex with flat $\mathfrak R$-contramodules of cocycles.
item.dc:creator: Leonid Positselski
